intro: Trichiogramme obtusifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved trichiogramma, is a small, annual herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Mediterranean and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Trichiogramme obtusifolia is often found in disturbed habitats and can be an indicator species for certain ecological conditions.
